isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC), Thermostatic Expansion Valve (TXV) System, March 2007 and Later - REMOVE AND INSTALL - PRESSURE TRANSDUCER

caution.para: The pressure transducer is not interchangeable with a pressure switch. To prevent damage to the A/C system replace a defective transducer only with the recommended part.

note.para: The pressure transducer can be removed and installed without removing the refrigerant from the A/C system.
Refer to Figure 16 while performing the following Remove and Install procedures.

svcprocinfo.para: The pressure transducer is located on the condenser-to-evaporator refrigerant line.

step1.para: Disconnect electrical connection to pressure transducer (2, Figure 16).
Unscrew pressure transducer from condenser-to-evaporator refrigerant line and cap open fitting.

figure.caption: Figure 16. Typical Locations of A/C Condenser and Pressure Transducer

calloutgroup.callout1: 1. CONDENSER A. POST AND SOCKET MOUNTING METHOD B. TAB AND BOLT MOUNTING METHOD

step1.para: Install a new O-ring on transducer fitting and lubricate O-ring and threads with mineral-based oil.
Screw pressure transducer onto A/C line fitting and tighten to 6.8 to 13.6 N•m. (5 to 10 lbf-ft).
Connect electrical connector to pressure transducer (2).
